final_poem:
Whispers of the Past

In shadows long and deep,  
Echoes softly creep.  
Memories weave their tales,  
Through time's relentless sails.

A scent of jasmine blooms,  
Or laughter in old rooms—  
Each fragment gently laid,  
To piece together our way.

Sunset paints the skies,  
As stories rise and fly.  
In dreams we wander free,  
Across the lands of memory.
